MenuItem.title: MenuItem
MenuItem.description: Represents an item available on the canteen menu.

id.description: Unique identifier for the menu item.

description.description: Detailed description of the menu item.

imageUrl.description: URL of the image for the menu item.

orderDate.description: Date and time when the order was placed.

totalAmount.description: The total amount of the order.

orderItems.description: List of items included in the order.

OrderItem.title: OrderItem
OrderItem.description: Represents a single item within an order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the order item.

quantity.description: Quantity of the menu item in this order item.

price.description: Price of this item. Note that this may vary from current price of the item and the time of purchase.

definition.description: Stores all menu items available in the canteen.

params.name: menuItemId
params.description: Unique identifier for the menu item.

definition.description: Stores all orders placed by customers.
Stores individual items within an order. (Relationship: Order 1:N OrderItem)

params.name: orderItemId
params.description: Unique identifier for the order item.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support a canteen ordering system with a focus on simplicity and scalability. The core entities are `MenuItem`, `Order`, and `OrderItem`. The structure leverages structural segregation by placing menu items in a top-level collection `/menu_items`, assuming all menu items share the same access control requirements. Orders are placed under a `/orders` collection. OrderItems are kept as a subcollection to Orders (`/orders/{orderId}/order_items`) to represent the 1:N relationship. No authorization context is required for this application, hence no denormalization is needed. This structure facilitates simple queries for menu items and orders and supports the required QAPs, as `list` operations are inherently secure due to the segregation of concerns.
